description: Come visit us at Gather, a hot glass studio in Charlton / Woolwich for an open studio day. On Friday 19th September, we are giving the public a unique insight into the world of glassblowing. All day, Gather will be producing their new range of lighting, providing visitors with making demonstrations. Visit us to see the process in action!

designers.architect: Designed by Edward George Rivers and built by Kirk and Randall in 1882–3

events.name: Drop in: Glassblowing studio open day
events.notes:
Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows
                    the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email
                    about any changes to the programme that might affect your
                    visit.

factsheet.heading: Gather Glass
paragraphs:
We are a hot glass studio based in Charlton / Woolwich. Gather was set up by founder, Phoebe Stubbs in summer 2023. Since then, she and her small artisan team have been producing glassware for Gather and for a number of interior and lighting clients. 
The studio runs on a large electric furnace – a commitment to reducing the use of fossil fuels. Gather also has two small electric furnaces for melting waste glass as well as a double ended reheating furnace, designed to make two workstations from one.

location.address: Unit 4, Submarine Cable Depot, Warspite Road, SE18 5NX
travel_info: Additional travel info: You can walk along the river from Woolwich or catch a very short bus. Buses also run right to our studio from Greenwich studio.

name: Glassblowing open studio
